entry.title: Armenia appoints first ambassador to Saudi Arabia

media:group.media:title: Armenia appoints first ambassador to Saudi Arabia
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan traveled to Iran for talks with the country‚Äôs top political and religious leadership. üìç Armenia and Turkey ‚Äúreconfirmed‚Äù their agreement to partially reopen their border, though without providing any timeframe. üìç Armenia named its first ambassador to Saudi Arabia and announced plans to open an embassy in Cyprus in the near future. üìç Garegin Khumaryan was replaced as the director of Armenian Public Radio after posting an op-ed criticizing Pashinyan.

media:group.media:title: ArmRadio‚Äôs Digitization of Armenian Jazz
media:group.media:description:
Arthur Ispirian, one of Armenia‚Äôs most prominent jazz musicians and the Director of archives at Armenian Public Radio, has dedicated the past seven years to digitizing the history of Armenian jazz.With the largest sound archive in the country, ArmRadio holds a century worth of physical recordings from Armenia‚Äôs jazz age. CivilNet visited Arthur to learn about his work.

entry.title: FemTech: Breaking taboos and promoting dialogue

media:group.media:title: FemTech: Breaking taboos and promoting dialogue
media:group.media:description:
Ida Tin, the co-founder and former CEO of Clue and the innovator who in 2016 coined the term ‚ÄúFemtech‚Äù speaks with CivilNet about the booming IT industry and the important role that women have to play in its development both in Armenia and beyond. She shared her insights about gender bias in AI, her experiences in developing, funding and promoting Femtech products and all the challenges that still need to be overcome.

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs musical renaissance
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the CivilNet podcast, host Patrick Elliott sits down with Van Armenian, accomplished violinist and founder of the Atken Armenian Foundation. Van shares his passion for nurturing musical talent in Armenia, discussing the foundation's transformational work in community building and supporting refugees. The conversation highlights the power of music in shaping Armenia's cultural landscape.

entry.title: Taraz dress designs with a modern twist

media:group.media:title: Taraz dress designs with a modern twist
media:group.media:description:
The Teryan Cultural Center is a non-profit organization in Yerevan that works to preserve all elements of Armenian national heritage, but has become most known for its efforts to design modern Armenian dresses. But the dresses are based on traditional women‚Äôs clothing, known as Taraz. CivilNet sits down with Lilit Melikyan, the center‚Äôs director, to talk about her work to represent and preserve Armenian heritage.

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs Zangezur mine expecting record production volumes: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs Zangezur mine expecting record production volumes: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs sole aluminum foil factory has named a new CEO, as the plant continues to operate at a loss following a string of Western sanctions on its Russian owner. üìçArmenia‚Äôs biggest mine said it is expecting to hit record production volumes this year, which would likely push its tax obligations to the Armenian government to $260 million. üìç Russia‚Äôs food safety agency banned 16 Armenian companies from exporting fresh produce to the country, raising fears of severe consequences for Armenian agriculture.

entry.title: Azerbaijan threatens to use its ‚Äòfull arsenal‚Äô against Armenia in self-defense

media:group.media:description:
üìç Azerbaijan has accused Armenia of using heavy weaponry against it, and threatened to take large-scale military action in response.
